sub_title: Hydrogen Supply Chain Opportunity Manager / Mentor Women in Tech
summary:
I am a purposeful and highly qualified professional with 14 years’ experience in renewable energy solutions, combining strong academic, technology  as well as business experience in hydrogen and low carbon fuels. I have demonstrated capacity in business opportunity management, techno economic analysis and delivering through others in highly innovative, uncertain and complex contexts. Comfortable with agile ways of working, passionate about continuous learning, process and data driven, I bring a natural sense of urgency, passion for the energy transition and strong drive to make it happen.

Currently managing business opportunities to help decarbonizing the heavy duty transport sector by scaling the hydrogen business.

Keen to develop into a more senior & strategic leadership role to make a larger impact in profitably driving businesses towards a more sustainable economy. 

PSPO I, PSPO II and PSM certification.
Mentor Women in Tech
Leadership/ Career Coach (working on ICF certification)  

My thoughts are my own and do not necessarily reflect the view of Shell.

projects.title: ADEM - Fuel Cells (Theme III)
projects.description:
ADEM Innovation Lab 
A green Deal in Energy Materials
ADEM Innovation Lab is A green Deal in Energy Materials in which Industrial partners, ECN and the Universities of Technology of Delft, Eindhoven and Twente have joined forces in research on materials for conversion, storage, and transport of energy. The ADEM programme covers the themes of Wind, Storage, Batteries, Membranes, Solar cells and Fuel cells. For more information, please refer to the dedicated programme page.

ADEM Innovation Lab strengthens the Dutch knowledge economy with joint expertise and an open and shared research infrastructure. The programme aims to materialise innovations in energy technologies in close collaboration with industry. For this reason, the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs supports this initiative with substantial funding.

Industrial partners can participate with cash or in-kind contributions of 10% or higher in ADEM’s research and make use of the shared research infrastructure. For more information, please refer to the Facility Sharing page.

courses.name: Business Management and Administration in the Chemical Industry

profile_positions.description:
o	Accountable for the delivery of business opportunities to build H2 truck trailers loading facilities in North West Europe. Opportunities portfolio > 100 M$ headline size. 
o	Opportunities maturation from assess to Final Investment decision, managing risks across technical, economical, commercial, operational, political aspects.
o	Managing the backlog of a team (~30 FTESs) of engineers, project managers supply chain managers, optimizers, asset managers, C&P leads across different lines of business/departments.
o	Internal/External Stakeholder Management: H2 business and operation, manufacturing, IT, landowners, subsidy providers business developers up to VP level.
o	Business Valuation – perform techno-economic analysis to drive opportunity development.
profile_positions.title: Hydrogen Mobility - Business Opportunity Manager

profile_positions.description:
o	Accountable for the delivery of digital products to simplify and optimize the low carbon fuels Trading & supply chain operations (2 M$ cost / year delivering around 30 M$ P&L/year)
o	Managing the backlog of a team of designers, software engineers, data scientists (14 FTEs)
o	Developed Product Vision, Roadmap and Scaling strategy 
o	Stakeholder Management: the low carbon fuels business and operation, manufacturing, distribution, IT, business developers (Sustainable Aviation Fuel, Hydrogen, Bio Gas/LNG, EV) up to VP level 
o	Change Management (transforming business operations/optimization from manual/monthly to digital/ daily)
profile_positions.title: Product Owner - Low Carbon Fuels Trading & Supply
Lead Electrochemical Routes CO2 to fuels

profile_positions.description: Project manager for the construction of an electrochemical lab at Shell Amsterdam, including 10+ testing stations for membranes, electrocatalysts and single cell/ small-stack electrolyzers / electrodialisis.  Guiding design of novel testing units and risk assessment.   Managing budget, planning, construction and commissioning. Currently 5+ researchers work safely in the lab.
profile_positions.title: (Electrochemistry) E-Lab manager

profile_positions.description:
Team member of R&D projects focused on improving classical separation technology as well as developing new process equipment, in particular related to liquid-liquid separation in the Oil&Gas Industry.
Daily tasks involves: 
- Process design, control and optimization
- Project commissioning
- Process testing
- Physico-chemical characterization of liquid-liquid systems
profile_positions.title: R&D Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Thesis - “Conductive Graphitic Networks: from atoms to fuel cells”
•	Exploring the use of a graphitic material patented in our group for applications in PEM Fuel Cells. Synthesis and characterization of colloids and (functionalized) carbon nanostructures and catalytic testing.
•	Collaboration  with TU Delft spin-off company CarbonX.
•	Successful applications for fundings for 2 European Research scholarships (COST).
•	Initiator and manager of collaborations with several research institutes.

Doctor degree awarded cum laude.
profile_positions.title: Researcher on Nanomaterials for Hydrogen Fuel Cells

Ex-Situ and In-Situ Characterization of Innovative Catalyst for low temperatures Fuel Cells (PEM and DMFC)
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher

profile_positions.description: Optimizing via CFD a methane steam reformer for a combined heat and power application based on a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell.
